page.title: 13STORNOWAY SOUTH - RELIGION
page.content: There are three main churches which are listed below,together with the size of congregation, date of establishment and denomination: {Free Church}(3000,1843,Free church of Scotland) {Martin's Memorial}(225,1875,Church of Scotland) {St Columuba's}(600,1800,Church of Scotland) Martin's Memorial church was built on the site of the house of the famous explorer, James Mackenzie who discovered the Mackenzie river in Canada. The Free church has two buildings, one for Gaelic and the other for English services. There is also a{Roman Catholic}church and a{Scottish Episcopal}church. Other religions reprsented in the area include Muslim and Baha'i.
